references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of Invariant Risk Minimization (IRM), a foundational concept for robust generalization beyond covariate shift, which is a central theme of the current paper.
This paper introduces the concept of multicalibration, which is extended and connected to out-of-distribution generalization in the current work.

references.paper_title: Universal adaptability: Target-independent inference that competes with propensity scoring
references.reason: This paper establishes crucial connections between multicalibration and robustness under covariate shift, which are further developed in the current paper.
This paper provides a boosting algorithm for multicalibration, which is closely related to the MC-Pseudolabel algorithm proposed in the current paper.
This paper introduces variance-based regularization which is relevant to the theoretical analysis of the MC-Pseudolabel algorithm's convergence.
